title: nf-core/metaboigniter pipeline parameters
description: Pre-processing of mass spectrometry-based metabolomics data with quantification and identification based on MS1 and MS2 data

global_options.title: Global options
global_options.description: General options that affect the whole pipeline

email.help_text: An email address to send a summary email to when the pipeline is completed.

internal_library_quantification_and_iden.title: Internal library quantification and identification parameters (negative mode)
internal_library_quantification_and_iden.description: Parameters used to tune library creation (only set if you want to do library idnetification)

quantification_openms_xcms_library_neg.description: set whether you want to do quantification with OpenMS (openms) or XCMS (xcms) in negative ionization  (for library)

performIPO_library_neg.help_text:
Possible values:
* `none`: don't perform IPO
* `global`: performs IPO on all or selected number of samples
* `local`: performs IPO on individual samples one at the time

ipo_methodXset_library_neg.help_text: Only centWave is supported at this stage.

ipo_snthresh_l_library_neg.description: lowest level of signal to noise threshold

ipo_snthresh_h_library_neg.description: highest level of signal to noise threshold

ipo_fitgauss_library_neg.description: logical, if TRUE a Gaussian is fitted

ipo_mzdiff_l_library_neg.description: lower minimum difference in m/z for peaks with overlapping retention times, can be negative to allow overlap

ipo_mzdiff_h_library_neg.description: higher minimum difference in m/z for peaks with overlapping retention times, can be negative to allow overlap

ipo_charge_camera_library_neg.description: maximum charge of molecules (only used in individual setting)

ipo_max_ppm_camera_library_neg.description: ppm mass deviation for adducts (only used in individual setting)

ipo_prefilter_l_l_library_neg.description: lower value of K in 'prefilter_library_neg=c(k,I)'. Prefilter step for the first phase. Mass traces are only retained if they contain at least 'k' peaks with intensity >_library_neg= 'I'.

ipo_prefilter_l_h_library_neg.description: higher value of K in 'prefilter_library_neg=c(k,I)'. Prefilter step for the first phase. Mass traces are only retained if they contain at least 'k' peaks with intensity >_library_neg= 'I'.

ipo_ncores_library_neg.description: number of cores used in IPO

ipo_profStep_l_library_neg.description: lower step size (in m/z) to use for profile generation from the raw data files

ipo_profStep_h_library_neg.description: higher step size (in m/z) to use for profile generation from the raw data files

ipo_response_l_library_neg.description: lower Responsiveness of warping.  0 will give a linear warp based on start and end points.  100 will use all bijective anchors

ipo_response_h_library_neg.description: higher Responsiveness of warping.  0 will give a linear warp based on start and end points.  100 will use all bijective anchors

ipo_factorDiag_l_library_neg.description: lower Local weighting applied to diagonal moves in alignment.

ipo_factorDiag_h_library_neg.description: higher Local weighting applied to diagonal moves in alignment.

ipo_factorGap_l_library_neg.description: lower Local weighting applied to gap moves in alignment.

ipo_factorGap_h_library_neg.description: higher Local weighting applied to gap moves in alignment.

ipo_bw_l_library_neg.description: lower bandwidth (consider something like retention time differences)

ipo_bw_h_library_neg.description: higher bandwidth (consider something like retention time differences)

ipo_minfrac_l_library_neg.description: lower minimum fraction of samples necessary in at least one of the sample groups for it to be a valid group

ipo_minfrac_h_library_neg.description: higher minimum fraction of samples necessary in at least one of the sample groups for it to be a valid group

ipo_minsamp_l_library_neg.description: lower minimum number of samples necessary in at least one of the sample groups for it to be a valid group

ipo_minsamp_h_library_neg.description: higher minimum number of samples necessary in at least one of the sample groups for it to be a valid group

ipo_max_l_library_neg.description: lower maximum number of groups to identify in a single m/z slice

ipo_max_h_library_neg.description: higher maximum number of groups to identify in a single m/z slice

ipo_distFunc_library_neg.description: DistFunc function: cor (Pearson's R) or cor_opt (default, calculate only 10% diagonal band of distance matrix, better runtime), cov (covariance), prd (product), euc (Euclidean distance)

mzdiff_quant_library_neg_xcms.description: minimum difference in m/z for peaks with overlapping retention times, can be negative to allow overlap

snthresh_quant_library_neg_xcms.description: signal to noise ratio cutoff, definition see below.

prefilter_quant_library_neg_xcms.description: K in 'prefilter=c(k,I)'. Prefilter step for the first phase. Mass traces are only retained if they contain at least 'k' peaks with intensity >= 'I'.

mzCenterFun_quant_library_neg_xcms.description: Function to calculate the m/z center of the feature: 'wMean' intensity weighted mean of the feature m/z values, 'mean' mean of the feature m/z values, 'apex' use m/z value at peak apex, 'wMeanApex3' intensity weighted mean of the m/z value at peak apex and the m/z value left and right of it, 'meanApex3' mean of the m/z value at peak apex and the m/z value left and right of it.

integrate_quant_library_neg_xcms.description: Integration method. If '=1' peak limits are found through descent on the mexican hat filtered data, if '=2' the descent is done on the real data. Method 2 is very accurate but prone to noise, while method 1 is more robust to noise but less exact.

fitgauss_quant_library_neg_xcms.description: logical, if TRUE a Gaussian is fitted

sampleclass_quant_library_neg_xcms.description: A name for the class of sample

sigma_group_library_neg_camera.description: sigma value for grouping the peaks across chromatogram

perfwhm_group_library_neg_camera.description: full width at half maximum for finding overlaping peaks

ppm_findaddcuts_library_neg_camera.description: ppm deviation between theoritical adduct mass and the experimental one

polarity_findaddcuts_library_neg_camera.description: this has to be negative (for testing only)!

maxcharge_findisotopes_library_neg_camer.description: number of changes to consider (most often 1 is enough)

ppm_mapmsmstocamera_library_neg_msnbase.description: ppm deviation when mapping MS2 parent ion to a mass trace

rt_mapmsmstocamera_library_neg_msnbase.description: rt difference (in second) for mapping MS2 parent ion to a mass trace (the mass trace is a range, star and end of the trace)

internal_library_parameters_negative_mod.title: Internal library parameters (negative mode)
internal_library_parameters_negative_mod.description: Parameters used to characterize the internal library

raw_file_name_preparelibrary_neg_msnbase.description: name of the column showing which raw files contain which metabolite in the library_description_neg csv file

compund_id_preparelibrary_neg_msnbase.description: name of the column showing id of the metabolites in the library_description_neg csv file

compound_name_preparelibrary_neg_msnbase.description: name of the compount column in the library_description_neg csv file

mz_col_preparelibrary_neg_msnbase.description: name of the mz column in the library_description_neg csv file

which_mz_preparelibrary_neg_msnbase.description: "f" or "c", showing whether the Feature range or centroid of the feature should be used for mapping

ncore_searchengine_library_neg_msnbase.description: Number of cores for mapping the features

ppm_create_library_neg_msnbase.description: ppm error for mapping the library characterization masses to the experimental one

output_preparation_negative_mode.title: Output preparation (negative mode)
output_preparation_negative_mode.description: Parameters that control how the results are outputted

ppm_output_neg_camera.description: relative difference of mass of the ID hit compare to a mass trace (ppm)

rt_output_neg_camera.description: retention time difference of ID to mass trace (second)

impute_output_neg_camera.description: should we impute adduct and different chance states with the same ID

type_column_output_neg_camera.description: Class of the samples (used for statistics and coverage calculations)

selected_type_output_neg_camera.description: what class of samples do you want to keep (anything not matching this in the Class column will be removed)

rename_output_neg_camera.description: you want to rename the files

rename_col_output_neg_camera.description: which column of the phenotype file to use for renaming

only_report_with_id_output_neg_camera.description: do only want to see the identified mass traces or everything?

combine_replicate_output_neg_camera.description: do you have technical replicates you want to average ?

combine_replicate_column_output_neg_came.description: which column of the phenotype file show the technical replicates

sample_coverage_output_neg_camera.description: any mass trace having more pecentage of the missing value will be removed

normalize_output_neg_camera.description: do you want to normalize the data set to 'NA' if you don't want normalization

database_csv_files_neg_cfmid.description: path to a csv file containing your database

ncore_neg_cfmid.description: number of cores that cfm can use

candidate_id_identification_neg_cfmid.description: name of the column in the database for id of the molecules

candidate_inchi_smiles_identification_ne.description: name of the column in the database for smile of the molecules

candidate_mass_identification_neg_cfmid.description: name of the column in the database for mass of the molecules

database_name_column_identification_neg_.description: name of the column in the database for name of the molecules

database_inchI_column_identification_neg.description: name of the column in the database for inchi of the molecules

database_csv_files_neg_metfrag.description: path to a csv file containing your database

ncore_neg_metfrag.description: number of cores that metfrag can use

database_csifingerid_neg_csifingerid.description: IMPORTANT: we don't support database file for csi:fingerid. You will need to provide what database to use here, the rest of the parameters will be taken from there parameter file

ncore_csifingerid_neg_csifingerid.description: number of cores that csi can use

timeout_csifingerid_neg_csifingerid.description: number of seconds that each csi ion can rum (time limit)

global_identification_parameters_negativ.title: Global identification parameters (negative mode)
global_identification_parameters_negativ.description: Parameters that will be used in all the search engines

ppm_mapmsmstocamera_neg_msnbase.description: ppm deviation when mapping MS2 parent ion to a mass trace

rt_mapmsmstocamera_neg_msnbase.description: rt difference (in second) for mapping MS2 parent ion to a mass trace (the mass trace is a range, star and end of the trace)

precursorppm_msmstoparam_neg_msnbase.description: relative mass tolerance of the precursor (ppm)

fragmentppm_msmstoparam_neg_msnbase.description: relative mass tolerance of the fragment ions (ppm)

fragmentabs_msmstoparam_neg_msnbase.description: absolute mass tolerance of the fragment ions

database_msmstoparam_neg_msnbase.description: type of database to use (see metaboIGNITER guide)

mode_msmstoparam_neg_msnbase.description: ionization method. This has to be neg (only for testing at this stage)

minPeaks_msmstoparam_neg_msnbase.description: ions with less that this number will be removed

adduct_and_isotope_annotation_negative_m.title: Adduct and isotope annotation (negative mode)
adduct_and_isotope_annotation_negative_m.description: Settings for CAMERA to detect adducts and isotopes

sigma_group_neg_camera.description: sigma value for grouping the peaks across chromatogram

perfwhm_group_neg_camera.description: full width at half maximum for finding overlaping peaks

ppm_findaddcuts_neg_camera.description: ppm deviation between theoritical adduct mass and the experimental one

polarity_findaddcuts_neg_camera.description: this has to be negative (for testing only)!

maxcharge_findisotopes_neg_camera.description: number of changes to consider (most often 1 is enough)

filtering_parameters_negative_mode.title: Filtering parameters (negative mode)
filtering_parameters_negative_mode.description: Parameters to use for performing QC, blank and dilution filtering

blank_filter_neg.description: set to true if you want to remove signal from blank

method_blankfilter_neg_xcms.description: method of sumarization of signal in blank samples

blank_blankfilter_neg_xcms.description: Name of the class of the blank samples

sample_blankfilter_neg_xcms.description: Name of the class of the biological samples

rest_blankfilter_neg_xcms.description: set to T to compare blanks only to rest of the samples

dilution_filter_neg.description: Whether blank filtereing should be done or not?

corto_dilutionfilter_neg_xcms.description: This series will used for calculation of correlation. For example if this parameter is set like 1,2,3 and the class of dilution trends is set as D1,D2,D3 the following the pairs will be used for calculating the correlation: (D1,1),(D2,2),(D3,3)

dilution_dilutionfilter_neg_xcms.description: The class of the samples represneting dilution. This has to be separated by comma!

pvalue_dilutionfilter_neg_xcms.description: p-value of the correlation. Anything higher than this will be removed!

corcut_dilutionfilter_neg_xcms.description: minimum expected correlation. Aniything lower than this will be removed!

abs_dilutionfilter_neg_xcms.description: If the tool should consider absolute correlation rather than the typical one from [-1 to 1] (F or T)

cv_filter_neg.description: select to whether perfrom cv filtering or not

cvcut_cvfilter_neg_xcms.description: Maximum coefficient of variation you expect. Anything higher than this will be removed!

quantification_openms_xcms_neg.description: set whether you want to do quantification with OpenMS (openms) or XCMS (xcms) in negative ionization

performIPO_neg.description: controls how to perform IPO possible values: "none": don't perform IPO, "global": performs IPO on all or selected number of samples. "global_quant": perform IPO only for quantification (not retention time correction and grouping), "local": performs IPO on individual samples one at the time. "local_quant": performs IPO on individual samples only for quantification, "local_RT": performs IPO on only for retention time correction and grouping.

ipo_allSamples_neg.description: Performs IPO on all the samples irrespective of the class they have

ipo_columnToSelect_neg.description: If ipo_allSamples_neg is false, one must pass the phenotype file to select sample. This parameter select the column of the phenotype file.

ipo_valueToSelect_neg.description: Selects the files only with this value in the columnToSelect column

ipo_methodXset_neg.description: Quantification methods for IPO. Only centWave is supported at this stage.

ipo_snthresh_l_neg.description: lowest level of signal to noise threshold

ipo_snthresh_h_neg.description: highest level of signal to noise threshold

ipo_integrate_neg.description: Integration method. If '=1' peak limits are found through descent on the mexican hat filtered data, if '=2' the descent is done on the real data. Method 2 is very accurate but prone to noise, while method 1 is more robust to noise but less exact.

ipo_fitgauss_neg.description: logical, if TRUE a Gaussian is fitte

ipo_mzdiff_l_neg.description: lower minimum difference in m/z for peaks with overlapping retention times, can be negative to allow overlap

ipo_mzdiff_h_neg.description: higher minimum difference in m/z for peaks with overlapping retention times, can be negative to allow overlap

ipo_charge_camera_neg.description: maximum charge of molecules (only used in individual setting)

ipo_max_ppm_camera_neg.description: ppm mass deviation for adducts (only used in individual setting)

ipo_prefilter_l_l_neg.description: lower value of K in 'prefilter_neg=c(k,I)'. Prefilter step for the first phase. Mass traces are only retained if they contain at least 'k' peaks with intensity >_neg= 'I'.

ipo_prefilter_l_h_neg.description: higher value of K in 'prefilter_neg=c(k,I)'. Prefilter step for the first phase. Mass traces are only retained if they contain at least 'k' peaks with intensity >_neg= 'I'.

ipo_ncores_neg.description: number of cores used in IPO

ipo_profStep_l_neg.description: lower step size (in m/z) to use for profile generation from the raw data files

ipo_profStep_h_neg.description: higher step size (in m/z) to use for profile generation from the raw data files

ipo_response_l_neg.description: lower Responsiveness of warping.  0 will give a linear warp based on start and end points.  100 will use all bijective anchors

ipo_response_h_neg.description: higher Responsiveness of warping.  0 will give a linear warp based on start and end points.  100 will use all bijective anchors

ipo_factorDiag_l_neg.description: lower Local weighting applied to diagonal moves in alignment

ipo_factorDiag_h_neg.description: higher Local weighting applied to diagonal moves in alignment

ipo_factorGap_l_neg.description: lower Local weighting applied to gap moves in alignment

ipo_factorGap_h_neg.description: higher Local weighting applied to gap moves in alignment

ipo_bw_l_neg.description: lower bandwidth (consider something like retention time differences)

ipo_bw_h_neg.description: higher bandwidth (consider something like retention time differences)

ipo_minfrac_l_neg.description: lower minimum fraction of samples necessary in at least one of the sample groups for it to be a valid group

ipo_minfrac_h_neg.description: higher minimum fraction of samples necessary in at least one of the sample groups for it to be a valid group

ipo_minsamp_l_neg.description: lower minimum number of samples necessary in at least one of the sample groups for it to be a valid group

ipo_minsamp_h_neg.description: higher minimum number of samples necessary in at least one of the sample groups for it to be a valid group

ipo_max_l_neg.description: lower maximum number of groups to identify in a single m/z slice

ipo_max_h_neg.description: higher maximum number of groups to identify in a single m/z slice

ipo_distFunc_neg.description: DistFunc function: cor (Pearson's R) or cor_opt (default, calculate only 10% diagonal band of distance matrix, better runtime), cov (covariance), prd (product), euc (Euclidean distance)

mzdiff_quant_neg_xcms.description: minimum difference in m/z for peaks with overlapping retention times, can be negative to allow overlap

snthresh_quant_neg_xcms.description: signal to noise ratio cutoff, definition see below.

prefilter_quant_neg_xcms.description: K in 'prefilter=c(k,I)'. Prefilter step for the first phase. Mass traces are only retained if they contain at least 'k' peaks with intensity >= 'I'.

mzCenterFun_quant_neg_xcms.description: Function to calculate the m/z center of the feature: 'wMean' intensity weighted mean of the feature m/z values, 'mean' mean of the feature m/z values, 'apex' use m/z value at peak apex, 'wMeanApex3' intensity weighted mean of the m/z value at peak apex and the m/z value left and right of it, 'meanApex3' mean of the m/z value at peak apex and the m/z value left and right of it.

integrate_quant_neg_xcms.description: Integration method. If '=1' peak limits are found through descent on the mexican hat filtered data, if '=2' the descent is done on the real data. Method 2 is very accurate but prone to noise, while method 1 is more robust to noise but less exact.

fitgauss_quant_neg_xcms.description: logical, if TRUE a Gaussian is fitted

phenodatacolumn_quant_neg.description: name of the column in the phenotype_design_neg showing class information of the samples

sampleclass_quant_neg_xcms.description: A name for the class of sample

profStep_align_N1_neg_xcms.description: step size (in m/z) to use for profile generation from the raw data files

center_align_N1_neg_xcms.description: the index of the sample all others will be aligned to. If center==NULL, the sample with the most peaks is chosen as default.

response_align_N1_neg_xcms.description: Responsiveness of warping.  0 will give a linear warp based on start and end points.  100 will use all bijective anchors

distFunc_align_N1_neg_xcms.description: DistFunc function: cor (Pearson's R) or cor_opt (default, calculate only 10% diagonal band of distance matrix, better runtime), cov (covariance), prd (product), euc (Euclidean distance)

factorDiag_align_N1_neg_xcms.description: Local weighting applied to diagonal moves in alignment

factorGap_align_N1_neg_xcms.description: Local weighting applied to gap moves in alignment

bandwidth_group_N1_neg_xcms.description: bandwidth (consider something like retention time differences)

minfrac_group_N1_neg_xcms.description: minimum fraction of samples necessary in at least one of the sample groups for it to be a valid group

minsamp_group_N1_neg_xcms.description: minimum number of samples necessary in at least one of the sample groups for it to be a valid group

max_group_N1_neg_xcms.description: maximum number of groups to identify in a single m/z slice

internal_library_quantification_and_iden.title: Internal library quantification and identification parameters (positive mode)
internal_library_quantification_and_iden.description: Parameters used to tune library creation (only set if you want to do library idnetification)

quantification_openms_xcms_library_pos.description: set whether you want to do quantification with OpenMS (openms) or XCMS (xcms) in positive ionization  (for library)

ipo_snthresh_h_library_pos.description: highest level of signal to noise threshold

combine_replicate_output_pos_camera.description: do you have technical replicates you want to average ?

combine_replicate_column_output_pos_came.description: which column of the phenotype file show the technical replicates

sample_coverage_output_pos_camera.description: any mass trace having more pecentage of the missing value will be removed

normalize_output_pos_camera.description: do you want to normalize the data set to 'NA' if you don't want normalization

database_csv_files_pos_cfmid.description: path to a csv file containing your database

ncore_pos_cfmid.description: number of cores that cfm can use

candidate_id_identification_pos_cfmid.description: name of the column in the database for id of the molecules

candidate_inchi_smiles_identification_po.description: name of the column in the database for smile of the molecules

candidate_mass_identification_pos_cfmid.description: name of the column in the database for mass of the molecules

database_name_column_identification_pos_.description: name of the column in the database for name of the molecules

database_inchI_column_identification_pos.description: name of the column in the database for inchi of the molecules

database_csv_files_pos_metfrag.description: path to a csv file containing your database

ncore_pos_metfrag.description: number of cores that metfrag can use

database_csifingerid_pos_csifingerid.description: IMPORTANT: we don't support database file for csi:fingerid. You will need to provide what database to use here, the rest of the parameters will be taken from there parameter file

ncore_csifingerid_pos_csifingerid.description: number of cores that csi can use

timeout_csifingerid_pos_csifingerid.description: number of seconds that each csi ion can rum (time limit)

global_identification_parameters_positiv.title: Global identification parameters (positive mode)
global_identification_parameters_positiv.description: Parameters that will be used in all the search engines

ppm_mapmsmstocamera_pos_msnbase.description: ppm deviation when mapping MS2 parent ion to a mass trace

rt_mapmsmstocamera_pos_msnbase.description: rt difference (in second) for mapping MS2 parent ion to a mass trace (the mass trace is a range, star and end of the trace)

precursorppm_msmstoparam_pos_msnbase.description: relative mass tolerance of the precursor (ppm)

fragmentppm_msmstoparam_pos_msnbase.description: relative mass tolerance of the fragment ions (ppm)

fragmentabs_msmstoparam_pos_msnbase.description: absolute mass tolerance of the fragment ions

database_msmstoparam_pos_msnbase.description: type of database to use (see metaboIGNITER guide)

mode_msmstoparam_pos_msnbase.description: ionization method. This has to be pos (only for testing at this stage)

minPeaks_msmstoparam_pos_msnbase.description: ions with less that this number will be removed

adduct_and_isotope_annotation_positive_m.title: Adduct and isotope annotation (positive mode)
adduct_and_isotope_annotation_positive_m.description: Settings for CAMERA to detect adducts and isotopes

sigma_group_pos_camera.description: sigma value for grouping the peaks across chromatogram

perfwhm_group_pos_camera.description: full width at half maximum for finding overlaping peaks

ppm_findaddcuts_pos_camera.description: ppm deviation between theoritical adduct mass and the experimental one

polarity_findaddcuts_pos_camera.description: this has to be positive (for testing only)!

maxcharge_findisotopes_pos_camera.description: number of changes to consider (most often 1 is enough)

filtering_parameters_positive_mode.title: Filtering parameters (positive mode)
filtering_parameters_positive_mode.description: Parameters to use for performing QC, blank and dilution filtering

blank_filter_pos.description: set to true if you want to remove signal from blank

method_blankfilter_pos_xcms.description: method of sumarization of signal in blank samples. Must be one of 'max', 'mean' or 'median'. For example, if 'max' is selected, a signal will be removed if it maximum abundance in the blank samples is higher than maximum abundance in biological samples.

blank_blankfilter_pos_xcms.description: Name of the class of the blank samples. This must show the class of blank samples exactly as you refer to them in your phenotype file

sample_blankfilter_pos_xcms.description: Name of the class of the biological samples

rest_blankfilter_pos_xcms.description: set to T to compare the blanks only to rest of the samples. If F, the blank signals will be compared with the samples with class sample_blankfilter_pos_xcms

dilution_filter_pos.description: Select whether you want to do dilution filtering

corto_dilutionfilter_pos_xcms.description: This series will used for calculation of correlation. For example if this parameter is set like 1,2,3 and the class of dilution trends is set as D1,D2,D3 the following the pairs will be used for calculating the correlation: (D1,1),(D2,2),(D3,3)

dilution_dilutionfilter_pos_xcms.description: The class of the samples represneting dilution. This has to be separated by comma! The samples are correlated to the exact order of the sequence provided here

pvalue_dilutionfilter_pos_xcms.description: p-value of the correlation. Anything higher than this will be removed!

corcut_dilutionfilter_pos_xcms.description: minimum expected correlation. Aniything lower than this will be removed!

abs_dilutionfilter_pos_xcms.description: If the tool should consider absolute correlation rather than the typical one from [-1 to 1] (F or T)

cv_filter_pos.description: select to whether perfrom cv filtering or not

cvcut_cvfilter_pos_xcms.description: Maximum coefficient of variation you expect. Anything higher than this will be removed!

quantification_openms_xcms_pos.description: set whether you want to do quantification with OpenMS (openms) or XCMS (xcms) in positive ionization

performIPO_pos.description: controls how to perform IPO possible values: "none": don't perform IPO, "global": performs IPO on all or selected number of samples. "global_quant": perform IPO only for quantification (not retention time correction and grouping), "local": performs IPO on individual samples one at the time. "local_quant": performs IPO on individual samples only for quantification, "local_RT": performs IPO on only for retention time correction and grouping.

ipo_allSamples_pos.description: Performs IPO on all the samples irrespective of the class they have

ipo_columnToSelect_pos.description: If ipo_allSamples_pos is false, one must pass the phenotype file to select sample. This parameter select the column of the phenotype file.

ipo_valueToSelect_pos.description: Selects the files only with this value in the columnToSelect column

ipo_methodXset_pos.description: Quantification methods for IPO. Only centWave is supported at this stage.

ipo_snthresh_l_pos.description: lowest level of signal to noise threshold

ipo_snthresh_h_pos.description: highest level of signal to noise threshold

ipo_integrate_pos.description: Integration method. If '=1' peak limits are found through descent on the mexican hat filtered data, if '=2' the descent is done on the real data. Method 2 is very accurate but prone to noise, while method 1 is more robust to noise but less exact.

ipo_fitgauss_pos.description: logical, if TRUE a Gaussian is fitte

ipo_mzdiff_l_pos.description: lower minimum difference in m/z for peaks with overlapping retention times, can be negative to allow overlap

ipo_mzdiff_h_pos.description: higher minimum difference in m/z for peaks with overlapping retention times, can be negative to allow overlap

ipo_charge_camera_pos.description: maximum charge of molecules (only used in individual setting)

ipo_max_ppm_camera_pos.description: ppm mass deviation for adducts (only used in individual setting)

ipo_prefilter_l_l_pos.description: lower value of K in 'prefilter_pos=c(k,I)'. Prefilter step for the first phase. Mass traces are only retained if they contain at least 'k' peaks with intensity >_pos= 'I'.

ipo_prefilter_l_h_pos.description: higher value of K in 'prefilter_pos=c(k,I)'. Prefilter step for the first phase. Mass traces are only retained if they contain at least 'k' peaks with intensity >_pos= 'I'.

ipo_ncores_pos.description: number of cores used in IPO

ipo_profStep_l_pos.description: lower step size (in m/z) to use for profile generation from the raw data files

ipo_profStep_h_pos.description: higher step size (in m/z) to use for profile generation from the raw data files

ipo_response_l_pos.description: lower Responsiveness of warping.  0 will give a linear warp based on start and end points.  100 will use all bijective anchors

ipo_response_h_pos.description: higher Responsiveness of warping.  0 will give a linear warp based on start and end points.  100 will use all bijective anchors

ipo_factorDiag_l_pos.description: lower Local weighting applied to diagonal moves in alignment

ipo_factorDiag_h_pos.description: higher Local weighting applied to diagonal moves in alignment

ipo_factorGap_l_pos.description: lower Local weighting applied to gap moves in alignment

ipo_factorGap_h_pos.description: higher Local weighting applied to gap moves in alignment

ipo_bw_l_pos.description: lower bandwidth (consider something like retention time differences)

ipo_bw_h_pos.description: higher bandwidth (consider something like retention time differences)

ipo_minfrac_l_pos.description: lower minimum fraction of samples necessary in at least one of the sample groups for it to be a valid group

ipo_minfrac_h_pos.description: higher minimum fraction of samples necessary in at least one of the sample groups for it to be a valid group

ipo_minsamp_l_pos.description: lower minimum number of samples necessary in at least one of the sample groups for it to be a valid group

ipo_minsamp_h_pos.description: higher minimum number of samples necessary in at least one of the sample groups for it to be a valid group

ipo_max_l_pos.description: lower maximum number of groups to identify in a single m/z slice

ipo_max_h_pos.description: higher maximum number of groups to identify in a single m/z slice

ipo_distFunc_pos.description: DistFunc function: cor (Pearson's R) or cor_opt (default, calculate only 10% diagonal band of distance matrix, better runtime), cov (covariance), prd (product), euc (Euclidean distance)

mzdiff_quant_pos_xcms.description: minimum difference in m/z for peaks with overlapping retention times, can be negative to allow overlap

snthresh_quant_pos_xcms.description: signal to noise ratio cutoff, definition see below.

prefilter_quant_pos_xcms.description: K in 'prefilter=c(k,I)'. Prefilter step for the first phase. Mass traces are only retained if they contain at least 'k' peaks with intensity >= 'I'.

mzCenterFun_quant_pos_xcms.description: Function to calculate the m/z center of the feature: 'wMean' intensity weighted mean of the feature m/z values, 'mean' mean of the feature m/z values, 'apex' use m/z value at peak apex, 'wMeanApex3' intensity weighted mean of the m/z value at peak apex and the m/z value left and right of it, 'meanApex3' mean of the m/z value at peak apex and the m/z value left and right of it.

integrate_quant_pos_xcms.description: Integration method. If '=1' peak limits are found through descent on the mexican hat filtered data, if '=2' the descent is done on the real data. Method 2 is very accurate but prone to noise, while method 1 is more robust to noise but less exact.

fitgauss_quant_pos_xcms.description: logical, if TRUE a Gaussian is fitted

phenodatacolumn_quant_pos.description: name of the column in the phenotype_design_pos showing class information of the samples

sampleclass_quant_pos_xcms.description: A name for the class of sample

profStep_align_N1_pos_xcms.description: step size (in m/z) to use for profile generation from the raw data files

center_align_N1_pos_xcms.description: the index of the sample all others will be aligned to. If center==NULL, the sample with the most peaks is chosen as default.

response_align_N1_pos_xcms.description: Responsiveness of warping.  0 will give a linear warp based on start and end points.  100 will use all bijective anchors

distFunc_align_N1_pos_xcms.description: DistFunc function: cor (Pearson's R) or cor_opt (default, calculate only 10% diagonal band of distance matrix, better runtime), cov (covariance), prd (product), euc (Euclidean distance)

factorDiag_align_N1_pos_xcms.description: Local weighting applied to diagonal moves in alignment

factorGap_align_N1_pos_xcms.description: Local weighting applied to gap moves in alignment

bandwidth_group_N1_pos_xcms.description: bandwidth (consider something like retention time differences)

minfrac_group_N1_pos_xcms.description: minimum fraction of samples necessary in at least one of the sample groups for it to be a valid group

minsamp_group_N1_pos_xcms.description: minimum number of samples necessary in at least one of the sample groups for it to be a valid group

max_group_N1_pos_xcms.description: maximum number of groups to identify in a single m/z slice

library_controls_and_files_negative_mode.title: Library controls and files (negative mode)
library_controls_and_files_negative_mode.description: Input files includes mzML files and settings for performing identification using internal library

library_charactrized_neg.description: if you have already charaztrized your negative library set this to true and specify the path for library_charactrization_file_neg

library_charactrization_file_neg.description: path to the file from charaztrized library (negative)

quant_library_mzml_files_neg.description: Path to a folder containing library mzML files used for doing adduct calcculation (MS1 data in megative ionization method)

id_library_mzml_files_neg.description: Path to a folder containing mzML files used for doing identification (MS2 data in negative ionization method)

library_description_neg.description: Path to a csv file containing description of the library for negative (see the help)

library_controls_and_files_positive_mode.title: Library controls and files (positive mode)
library_controls_and_files_positive_mode.description: Input files includes mzML files and settings for performing identification using internal library

library_charactrized_pos.description: if you have already charaztrized your positive library set this to true and specify the path for library_charactrization_file_pos

library_charactrization_file_pos.description: path to the file from charaztrized library (positive)

quant_library_mzml_files_pos.description: Path to a folder containing library mzML files used for doing adduct calcculation (MS1 data in positive ionization method)

id_library_mzml_files_pos.description: Path to a folder containing mzML files used for doing identification (MS2 data in positive ionization method)

library_description_pos.description: Path to a csv file containing description of the library for positive (see the help)

identification_input_files.title: Identification input files
identification_input_files.description: Input files includes mzML files for performing identification

id_mzml_files_pos.description: ath to a folder containing mzML files used for doing identification (MS2 data in positive ionization method)

id_mzml_files_neg.description: Path to a folder containing mzML files used for doing identification (MS2 data in negative ionization method)

control_parameters.title: Control parameters
control_parameters.description: Used to control functionality of the workflow e.g identification, quantification etc

publishDir_intermediate.description: set to true to publish all the middle stages

perform_identification.description: Set to false if you don't want to do identification. You will not require to set MS2 related parameters if you set this to false

perform_identification_metfrag.description: Should Metfrag be used for doing identification?

perform_identification_csifingerid.description: Should CSI:FingerID be used for doing identification?

perform_identification_cfmid.description: Should CFM-ID be used for doing identification?

perform_identification_internal_library.description: Should an internal library be used for doing identification?

type_of_ionization.description: You can either set to 'pos' (only positive), 'neg' (only negative), 'both' (both positive and negative).

need_centroiding.description: Set to true if your data is in profile mode (only for quantification!)

openms_setting_files.title: OpenMS setting files
openms_setting_files.description: Used for peak picking and feature detection

peakpicker_ini_file_pos_openms.description: Path to the ini file for PeakPickerHiRes

peakpicker_ini_file_neg_openms.description: Path to the ini file for PeakPickerHiRes

featurefinder_ini_pos_openms.description: Path to the ini file for OpenMS FeatureFinderMetabo in positive mode

featurefinder_ini_neg_openms.description: Path to the ini file for OpenMS FeatureFinderMetabo in negative mode

peakpicker_ini_file_library_pos_openms.description: Path to the ini file for PeakPickerHiRes (for library)

peakpicker_ini_file_library_neg_openms.description: Path to the ini file for PeakPickerHiRes  (for library)

featurefinder_ini_library_pos_openms.description: Path to the ini file for OpenMS FeatureFinderMetabo in positive mode  (for library)

featurefinder_ini_library_neg_openms.description: Path to the ini file for OpenMS FeatureFinderMetabo in negative mode  (for library)

quantification_input_files.title: Quantification input files
quantification_input_files.description: Input files includes mzML files for performing quantification

input.description: Path to a folder containing mzML files used for doing quantification (MS1 data in positive ionization method)

quant_mzml_files_neg.description: Path to a folder containing mzML files used for doing quantification (MS1 data in negative ionization method)

phenotype_design_pos.description: Path to a csv file containing the experimental design (MS1 data in positive ionization method)

phenotype_design_neg.description: Path to a csv file containing the experimental design (MS1 data in negative ionization method)

generic_options.title: Generic options
generic_options.description: Less common options for the pipeline, typically set in a config file.
generic_options.help_text:
These options are common to all nf-core pipelines and allow you to customise some of the core preferences for how the pipeline runs.

Typically these options would be set in a Nextflow config file loaded for all pipeline runs, such as `~/.nextflow/config`.

publish_dir_mode.description: Method used to save pipeline results to output directory.
publish_dir_mode.help_text: The Nextflow `publishDir` option specifies which intermediate files should be saved to the output directory. This option tells the pipeline what method should be used to move these files. See [Nextflow docs](https://www.nextflow.io/docs/latest/process.html#publishdir) for details.

validate_params.description: Boolean whether to validate parameters against the schema at runtime

email_on_fail.description: Email address for completion summary, only when pipeline fails.
email_on_fail.help_text: This works exactly as with `--email`, except emails are only sent if the workflow is not successful.

plaintext_email.description: Send plain-text email instead of HTML.
plaintext_email.help_text: Set to receive plain-text e-mails instead of HTML formatted.

monochrome_logs.description: Do not use coloured log outputs.
monochrome_logs.help_text: Set to disable colourful command line output and live life in monochrome.

tracedir.description: Directory to keep pipeline Nextflow logs and reports.

show_hidden_params.help_text: By default, parameters set as _hidden_ in the schema are not shown on the command line when a user runs with `--help`. Specifying this option will tell the pipeline to show all parameters.

max_job_request_options.title: Max job request options
max_job_request_options.description: Set the top limit for requested resources for any single job.
max_job_request_options.help_text:
If you are running on a smaller system, a pipeline step requesting more resources than are available may cause the Nextflow to stop the run with an error. These options allow you to cap the maximum resources requested by any single job so that the pipeline will run on your system.

Note that you can not _increase_ the resources requested by any job using these options. For that you will need your own configuration file. See [the nf-core website](https://nf-co.re/usage/configuration) for details.

max_cpus.description: Maximum number of CPUs that can be requested    for any single job.
max_cpus.help_text: Use to set an upper-limit for the CPU requirement for each process. Should be an integer e.g. `--max_cpus 1`

max_memory.description: Maximum amount of memory that can be requested for any single job.
max_memory.help_text: Use to set an upper-limit for the memory requirement for each process. Should be a string in the format integer-unit e.g. `--max_memory '8.GB'`

max_time.description: Maximum amount of time that can be requested for any single job.
max_time.help_text: Use to set an upper-limit for the time requirement for each process. Should be a string in the format integer-unit e.g. `--max_time '2.h'`

institutional_config_options.title: Institutional config options
institutional_config_options.description: Parameters used to describe centralised config profiles. These should not be edited.
institutional_config_options.help_text: The centralised nf-core configuration profiles use a handful of pipeline parameters to describe themselves. This information is then printed to the Nextflow log when you run a pipeline. You should not need to change these values when you run a pipeline.

custom_config_version.description: Git commit id for Institutional configs.
custom_config_version.help_text:
Provide git commit id for custom Institutional configs hosted at `nf-core/configs`. This was implemented for reproducibility purposes. Default: `master`.

```bash
 Download and use config file with following git commit id
--custom_config_version d52db660777c4bf36546ddb188ec530c3ada1b96
```

custom_config_base.help_text:
If you're running offline, nextflow will not be able to fetch the institutional config files from the internet. If you don't need them, then this is not a problem. If you do need them, you should download the files from the repo and tell nextflow where to find them with the `custom_config_base` option. For example:

```bash
 Download and unzip the config files
cd /path/to/my/configs
wget https://github.com/nf-core/configs/archive/master.zip
unzip master.zip

 Run the pipeline
cd /path/to/my/data
nextflow run /path/to/pipeline/ --custom_config_base /path/to/my/configs/configs-master/
```

> Note that the nf-core/tools helper package has a `download` command to download all required pipeline files + singularity containers + institutional configs in one go for you, to make this process easier.
